latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Research and Technology.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Research and Technology.

Referred to the Committee on Small Business, and in addition to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: Stimulating Innovation through Procurement Act of 2017
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 93 (Tuesday, May 30, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. MURPHY of Florida:H.R. 2767.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 grants Congress the power to regulatecommerce among the several states, and to make all laws whichshall be necessary and proper for carrying into executionthis power.[Page H4618]

item.latestTitle: Small Business Innovation Research and Small Business Technology Transfer Improvements Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

item.title: Stimulating Innovation through Procurement Act of 2017

To amend the Small Business Act to require senior procurement executives, procurement center representatives, and the Office of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization to assist small business concerns participating in the Small Business Innovation Research Program and the Small Business Technology Transfer Program, and for other purposes.
Stimulating Innovation through Procurement Act of 2017

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Stimulating Innovation through Procurement Act of 2017

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
